U of L great Michael Bush back on an NFL roster

Jonathan Lintner, jlintner@courier-journal.com 5:26 p.m. EST November 25, 2014

Then-Chicago Bears running back Michael Bush dashes past a Cleveland Browns defender during a Dec. 15, 2013 game in Cleveland.(Photo: AP Photo/Tony Dejak)

1 CONNECT 10 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Just last Sunday, a Twitter user sent to Michael Bush, "Please bless my fantasy team with bountiful yards and a plethora of touchdowns." It was then that Bush, the Louisville native, Male High School graduate and former University of Louisville star, reminded the guy he wasn't on a roster.

That changed Tuesday, though, when the Arizona Cardinals announced they've signed the bruising running back Bush to a contract through the end of this season, hoping he can boost the team's struggling running game.

Bush, 30, has spent this season as an NFL free agent after last year rushing for 197 yards with three touchdowns for the Chicago Bears. The seventh-year pro has 3,250 career yards to go with 29 scores.

His role with the Cardinals will be as a replacement for Jonathan Dywer, placed on the non-football illness reserve list after the second game of the season as a result of his arrest for alleged domestic violence. Arizona, which with a 9-2 record leads the NFC West, has averaged 2.5 yards per carry or less as a team over its last three games.

"I've never been in a situation like this," offensive coordinator Harold Goodwin said last week, according to AZCardinals.com. "We just have to deliver. It's about coaches and players being on the same page, and once we get to the grass, execute."

NFL:Chicago Bears cut former Louisville running back Michael Bush

To make room for Bush, who measures at 6-foot-1 and 245 pounds, the Cardinals released running back Kerwynn Williams.

At U of L, Bush rushed for 1,143 yards as a junior and chose to return to school, expected as a top 10 draft pick. But he broke his tibia in the season-opener and was ruled out for the year. The Oakland Raiders selected Bush in the fourth round of the 2007 draft, and he spent four seasons there before playing two for the Bears.

Jonathan Lintner can be reached at (502) 582-4199. Follow him on Twitter @JonathanLintner.
